question: The solar eclipse achieves totality only in the limited geographical regions because?
option1: the earth is not a smooth flat surface, but has elevations and depressions
option2: the size of the shadow of the moon on the earth is small compared to the cross section of the earth
option3: the trajectories of the earth around the sun and the moon around the earth are not perfect circles
option4: sun rays can reach most of the peripheral regions of the shadow of the moon due to a atmospheric refraction
answer: the size of the shadow of the moon on the earth is small compared to the cross section of the earth
explanation: Because of the geometry of eclipses, the moon\'s shadow is narrow when it reaches Earth, so the region from which the eclipse is visible is small. The shadow can never be more than 166 miles wide. People outside the path of totality can see a partial eclipse, with the moon covering only a portion of the sun\'s disk.
